This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>French and Francophone Studies</title>   <subtitle>The Department of French and Francophone Studies is one of the largest French departments in the UK. We are therefore able to offer specialist teaching across the range of French studies: literature, film, media, visual culture, history, politics, intellectual history, linguistics and translation studies.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/frenchandfrancophonestudies.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/frenchandfrancophonestudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-06T08:59:50Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/frenchandfrancophonestudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>French and Contemporary Chinese Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-contemporary-chinese.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>While a great deal of attention in the western media in recent years has focused on the arrival of China as a significant player on the global stage, it is easily forgotten that France is still a leading force in world politics. This course offers you the opportunity to study these two very different, but in some ways complementary cultures.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:37:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T13:37:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-contemporary-chinese.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>French Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Susie Colley</name>     </author>     <summary>Alongside core language modules in years one, two and four of the course, you can choose from a wide range of optional modules covering French literature, linguistics, history, politics, culture and film. More specialised language modules are available in year four.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:36:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T14:26:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern Languages at The University of Nottingham are part of the School of Cultures, Languages and Area Studies (CLAS). Studying a modern language involves much more than just learning to speak the language.You will gain expertise in national and regional cultures and cover themes such as film, history, linguistics, literature, media and politics, amongst others.</summary>     <published>2014-06-10T15:45:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T16:22:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>English and French BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/english-french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>English Studies and French offers you the opportunity to combine studies in French language with the literature and culture of both French and English. You will normally devote half of your time to each discipline.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:38:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T12:43:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/english-french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>French and History BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-history.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers you the opportunity to combine studies in French language, literature and culture with a wide range of modules in history. You will normally devote half your time to each discipline.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:36:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T12:47:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-history.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguages.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>The School received the top rating for teaching in the latest independent review of quality, and each department is internationally recognised for the standard of its research. We offer a wide range of degree subjects, flexible course structures and an extensive selection of optional modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:34:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T12:52:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguages.aspx</id>     <category term="Modern Languages" />     <category term="Modern Languages and Cultures" />     <category term="cultures" />     <category term="Languages and Area studies" />     <category term="Languages" />     <category term="Culture" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>French and Politics BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-politics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course, you have the opportunity to combine studies in French language, literature and culture with a wide range of political topics. You will develop your French language skills to degree level, while learning to compare and contrast political institutions and behaviour in liberal democracies.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:36:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T12:53:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-politics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>French and Philosophy BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-philosophy.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>On this course you will combine studies in French language, literature and culture with a wide range of philosophical topics. You will normally devote half your time to each discipline.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:33:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T12:50:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/frenchandfrancophonestudies/french-philosophy.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with French BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of these degrees is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:15:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>French and International Media and Communications Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/french-international-media-communications.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This degree offers you the opportunity to combine studies in French language, literature and culture along with the theory and history of communications in a global context. You will normally divide your time equally between both subjects, taking core and optional modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:38:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T11:34:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/culture,filmandmedia/french-international-media-communications.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Law with French and French Law BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/law/law-french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Zoe Haslam</name>     </author>     <summary>This course is designed to equip students with a legal qualification based on English law and to encourage an appreciation of European law and French law, allied to linguistic competence, and cultural awareness of the country.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:05:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-29T11:55:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/law/law-french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Management with French BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/business/management-french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Paul Gelsthorpe</name>     </author>     <summary>Covering the same core areas as BSc Management, this course also offers you the opportunity to perfect your command of French. In addition to management modules, you will also study four French-related modules each year.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:59:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-19T13:02:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/business/management-french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern European Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern European Studies is available in three different branches: modern history and two modern languages; politics and two modern languages; or modern history, politics and one modern language.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:31:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages with Translation BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-with-translation.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Information on Modern Languages with Translation BA</summary>     <published>2013-08-15T16:30:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-with-translation.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Language Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to study three languages; you can choose three from post-A level French, German, Russian or Spanish, or two from those above along with beginners' modules in either Russian, German, Serbian/Croatian, Portuguese, Slovene, Spanish or Dutch.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:33:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages with Business BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to combine the study of two European languages to final degree level with a range of nonlinguistic modules and business modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T15:21:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
